data.title: Adversarial training produces synthetic data for machine learning
data.description: Sentiment analysis is the attempt, computationally, to determine from someone’s words how he or she feels about something. It has a host of applications, in market research, media analysis, customer service, and product recommendation, among other things.

data.title: Manipulation By Feel
data.description: The BAIR Blog

data.title: Implicit Generation and Generalization Methods for Energy-Based Models
data.description: We’ve made progress towards stable and scalable training of energy-based models (EBMs) resulting in better sample quality and generalization ability than existing models. Generation in EBMs spends more compute to continually refine its answers and doing so can generate samples competitive with GANs at low temperatures, while also having mode coverage guarantees of likelihood-based models. We hope these findings stimulate further research into this promising class of models.

data.title: Machine-labeled data + artificial noise = better speech recognition
